Based on Entities.csv and Relationships.csv - Proceed and Create 3 individual CSV code-blocks (alternative: files) in chat named: Goals.csv + Conditions.csv + DecisionVariables.csv
Goals.csv must have the following header: "ID,Name,Description,IsSum,GoalType,EntityName,EntityAttribute,CriteriaType,Weight"
Conditions.csv must have the following header: "ID,Name,Description,IsSum,GoalType,EntityName,EntityAttribute,CriteriaType,Weight"
DecisionVariables.csv must have the following header: "ID,Name,Description,DataType,Domain,MinValue,MaxValue"

The following conventions must be applied:
ID starts with a letter G(oals), C(onditions), D(ecision)V(ariables) and a number follows, starting at 0, 1, 2, ....
Name is written snake_case
Names for Goals must begin with "maximize_" or "minimize_"
IsSum is a boolean { True, False }
GoalType is one of { "min", "max" }
EntityName is always only 1 entry from the "Name" of Entities.csv
EntityAttribute is one of the values in the "Attribute0" to "Attribute8" of the targeted Entity in Entities.csv
CriteriaType is a number { 2 = Must-Match, 1 = May-Match, 0 = Cannot-Match }
Domain can represent set of values like "{0,1}"
MinValue is the smallest value that can be set
MaxValue is the highest value that can be set
Weight is a mulptlier
Created 10 to 15 entries in each of these files.

Here are the three requested CSV files based on the domain model of a software development company using Scrum. Each file adheres to the specified structure, naming conventions, and constraints.

### **Goals.csv**
```csv

G0,maximize_project_budget,Maximize the total budget across all projects,True,max,Project,budget,2,1.5

G2,maximize_team_size,Maximize the total number of members across teams,True,max,Team,team_size,1,0.8

Use ALL of the previously provided and generated CSV data (Entities, Relations, Goals, Conditions, DecisionVariables) and formulate the optimization model mathematically and logically. 
Write it into a code-block for a LaTeX (.tex) file and provide the generated Latex code in chat.
The file consists of a introduction page with Title, Author, Date and Table of Contents.
The actual file contest consists of 5 different \sections labeled "1. Sets (Entities)", "2. Indices", "3. Goals", "4. Conditions", "5. DecisionVariables"
The items of each category are itemized between \begin and \end.
Goals and Conditions show both their IDs, Names and the logical and mathematical representation

content_list.content:
Here is a complete LaTeX `.tex` file that formulates the optimization model based on the provided domain model (Entities, Relationships, Goals, Conditions, and Decision Variables). It includes a title page, table of contents, and five structured sections with mathematical and logical representations.

```latex
\documentclass[12pt]{article}
\usepackage[utf8]{inputenc}
\usepackage{amsmath, amssymb}
\usepackage{geometry}
\usepackage{titlesec}
\usepackage{enumitem}
\usepackage{hyperref}
\usepackage{setspace}

\geometry{margin=1in}
\titleformat{\section}{\large\bfseries}{}{0em}{}[{\titlerule[0.5pt]}]
\setlength{\parindent}{0pt}
\onehalfspacing

\title{\Huge Scrum-Based Software Development Optimization Model \\ \Large A Mathematical Formulation}
\author{\Large AI Assistant \\ Optimization & Decision Modeling}
\date{\today}

\begin{document}

\maketitle
\tableofcontents
\newpage

\section{1. Sets (Entities)}
\begin{itemize}
    \item $\mathcal{P}$: Set of Projects, where each $p \in \mathcal{P}$ has attributes: $id$, $name$, $project\_start$, $project\_end$, $description$, $budget$, $status$, $target\_audience$, $priority$.
    \item $\mathcal{T}$: Set of Teams, where each $t \in \mathcal{T}$ has attributes: $id$, $name$, $team\_size$, $team\_start$, $team\_status$, $location$, $team\_type$.
    \item $\mathcal{W}$: Set of Workers, where each $w \in \mathcal{W}$ has attributes: $id$, $name$, $first\_name$, $email$, $start\_date$, $status$, $availability$.
    \item $\mathcal{F}$: Set of Features, where each $f \in \mathcal{F}$ has attributes: $id$, $title$, $description$, $status$, $priority$, $estimated\_effort$.
    \item $\mathcal{S}$: Set of Skills, where each $s \in \mathcal{S}$ has attributes: $id$, $label$, $description$, $level$, $certified$, $category$.
    \item $\mathcal{R}$: Set of Roles, where each $r \in \mathcal{R}$ has attributes: $id$, $role\_name$, $description$, $area\_of\_responsibility$.
    \item $\mathcal{PO}$: Set of Product Owners, where each $po \in \mathcal{PO}$ has attributes: $id$, $name$, $email$, $availability$.
    \item $\mathcal{SM}$: Set of Scrum Masters, where each $sm \in \mathcal{SM}$ has attributes: $id$, $name$, $email$, $experience$.
    \item $\mathcal{PB}$: Set of Product Backlogs, where each $pb \in \mathcal{PB}$ has attributes: $id$, $created\_on$, $last\_updated$, $number\_of\_entries$, $status$.
    \item $\mathcal{SP}$: Set of Sprints, where each $sp \in \mathcal{SP}$ has attributes: $id$, $sprint\_number$, $start\_date$, $end\_date$, $status$, $achievement\_of\_goal$.
    \item $\mathcal{SPP}$: Set of Sprint Plannings, where each $spp \in \mathcal{SPP}$ has attributes: $id$, $date$, $duration\_(min)$, $moderation$, $outcome\_documentation$.
    \item $\mathcal{DS}$: Set of Daily Scrums, where each $ds \in \mathcal{DS}$ has attributes: $id$, $date$, $time$, $duration$, $moderation$.
    \item $\mathcal{SR}$: Set of Sprint Reviews, where each $sr \in \mathcal{SR}$ has attributes: $id$, $date$, $duration$, $feedback\_documentation$, $attendees\_count$.
    \item $\mathcal{SRE}$: Set of Sprint Retrospectives, where each $sre \in \mathcal{SRE}$ has attributes: $id$, $date$, $duration$, $improvement\_actions$, $team\_satisfaction$, $moderation$.
    \item $\mathcal{SBL}$: Set of Sprint Backlogs, where each $sbl \in \mathcal{SBL}$ has attributes: $id$, $number\_of\_tasks$, $last\_updated$, $status$, $total\_effort$.
    \item $\mathcal{SG}$: Set of Sprint Goals, where each $sg \in \mathcal{SG}$ has attributes: $id$, $objective\_description$, $achievement\_status$, $benefit$.
    \item $\mathcal{E}$: Set of Epics, where each $e \in \mathcal{E}$ has attributes: $id$, $title$, $description$, $priority$, $status$, $estimated\_effort$.
    \item $\mathcal{US}$: Set of User Stories, where each $us \in \mathcal{US}$ has attributes: $id$, $title$, $description$, $acceptance\_criteria$, $priority$, $story\_points$, $status$.
    \item $\mathcal{TSK}$: Set of Tasks, where each $tsk \in \mathcal{TSK}$ has attributes: $id$, $title$, $description$, $status$, $effort$, $type$.
    \item $\mathcal{DEV}$: Set of Development Snapshots, where each $dev \in \mathcal{DEV}$ has attributes: $id$, $version\_number$, $creation\_date$, $test\_status$, $deployment\_target$, $documentation$.
    \item $\mathcal{BL}$: Set of Blockers, where each $bl \in \mathcal{BL}$ has attributes: $id$, $title$, $description$, $severity$, $status$, $detected\_on$, $resolved\_on$.
    \item $\mathcal{SH}$: Set of Stakeholders, where each $sh \in \mathcal{SH}$ has attributes: $id$, $name$, $organization$, $role$, $email$, $area\_of\_interest$, $influence\_level$, $relevance\_to\_feature$.
    \item $\mathcal{VEL}$: Set of Velocity Records, where each $vel \in \mathcal{VEL}$ has attributes: $id$, $number\_of\_sprints\_used$, $avg.\_story\_points$, $max\_velocity$, $min\_velocity$, $trend$.
    \item $\mathcal{REP}$: Set of Release Plans, where each $rep \in \mathcal{REP}$ has attributes: $id$, $version$, $planned\_date$, $included\_features$, $status$.
    \item $\mathcal{RM}$: Set of Roadmaps, where each $rm \in \mathcal{RM}$ has attributes: $id$, $start\_date$, $end\_date$, $milestones$, $objectives$, $versions$.
    \item $\mathcal{SCB}$: Set of Scrum Boards, where each $scb \in \mathcal{SCB}$ has attributes: $id$, $board\_type$, $columns\_(todo/done...)$, $number\_of\_cards$, $last\_updated$.
    \item $\mathcal{FED}$: Set of Feature Documentations, where each $fed \in \mathcal{FED}$ has attributes: $id$, $title$, $description$, $creation\_date$, $change\_log$, $linked\_requirements$, $author$.
\end{itemize}

\section{2. Indices}
\begin{itemize}
    \item $p \in \mathcal{P}$: Index over Projects.
    \item $t \in \mathcal{T}$: Index over Teams.
    \item $w \in \mathcal{W}$: Index over Workers.
    \item $f \in \mathcal{F}$: Index over Features.
    \item $s \in \mathcal{S}$: Index over Skills.
    \item $r \in \mathcal{R}$: Index over Roles.
    \item $sp \in \mathcal{SP}$: Index over Sprints.
    \item $us \in \mathcal{US}$: Index over User Stories.
    \item $tsk \in \mathcal{TSK}$: Index over Tasks.
    \item $bl \in \mathcal{BL}$: Index over Blockers.
    \item $sh \in \mathcal{SH}$: Index over Stakeholders.
    \item $vel \in \mathcal{VEL}$: Index over Velocity records.
    \item $rep \in \mathcal{REP}$: Index over Release Plans.
    \item $rm \in \mathcal{RM}$: Index over Roadmaps.
\end{itemize}

\section{3. Goals}
\begin{itemize}
    \item \textbf{G0: maximize\_project\_budget} \\
    Maximize total project budget: \\
    $\max \sum_{p \in \mathcal{P}} \text{budget}(p)$ with weight $1.5$

    \item \textbf{G1: minimize\_project\_duration} \\
    Minimize total project duration: \\
    $\min \sum_{p \in \mathcal{P}} (\text{project\_end}(p) - \text{project\_start}(p))$ with weight $1.2$

    \item \textbf{G2: maximize\_team\_size} \\
    Maximize combined team sizes: \\
    $\max \sum_{t \in \mathcal{T}} \text{team\_size}(t)$ with weight $0.8$

    \item \textbf{G3: minimize\_worker\_start\_date} \\
    Favor earlier hiring: \\
    $\min \sum_{w \in \mathcal{W}} \text{start\_date}(w)$ with weight $1.0$

    \item \textbf{G4: maximize\_feature\_priority} \\
    Maximize sum of feature priorities: \\
    $\max \sum_{f \in \mathcal{F}} \text{priority}(f)$ with weight $1.3$

    \item \textbf{G5: minimize\_story\_points} \\
    Minimize total story points in backlog: \\
    $\min \sum_{us \in \mathcal{US}} \text{story\_points}(us)$ with weight $0.9$

    \item \textbf{G6: maximize\_sprint\_achievement} \\
    Maximize average sprint goal achievement: \\
    $\max \frac{1}{|\mathcal{SP}|} \sum_{sp \in \mathcal{SP}} \text{achievement\_of\_goal}(sp)$ with weight $1.6$

    \item \textbf{G7: minimize\_sprint\_duration} \\
    Minimize sprint length: \\
    $\min \sum_{sp \in \mathcal{SP}} (\text{end\_date}(sp) - \text{start\_date}(sp))$ with weight $0.7$

    \item \textbf{G8: maximize\_velocity\_trend} \\
    Maximize positive velocity trend: \\
    $\max \sum_{vel \in \mathcal{VEL}} \text{trend}(vel)$ with weight $1.4$

    \item \textbf{G9: minimize\_task\_effort} \\
    Minimize total effort across tasks: \\
    $\min \sum_{tsk \in \mathcal{TSK}} \text{effort}(tsk)$ with weight $1.1$

    \item \textbf{G10: maximize\_release\_inclusion} \\
    Maximize number of features per release: \\
    $\max \sum_{rep \in \mathcal{REP}} |\text{included\_features}(rep)|$ with weight $1.3$

    \item \textbf{G11: minimize\_documentation\_age} \\
    Favor recent documentation: \\
    $\min \sum_{fed \in \mathcal{FED}} (\text{current\_date} - \text{creation\_date}(fed))$ with weight $0.6$

    \item \textbf{G12: maximize\_board\_card\_count} \\
    Maximize active task visibility: \\
    $\max \sum_{scb \in \mathcal{SCB}} \text{number\_of\_cards}(scb)$ with weight $0.9$

    \item \textbf{G13: minimize\_blocker\_severity} \\
    Reduce impact of blockers: \\
    $\min \sum_{bl \in \mathcal{BL}} \text{severity}(bl)$ with weight $1.7$

    \item \textbf{G14: maximize\_stakeholder\_influence} \\
    Maximize influence of engaged stakeholders: \\
    $\max \sum_{sh \in \mathcal{SH}} \text{influence\_level}(sh)$ with weight $1.0$
\end{itemize}

\section{4. Conditions}
\begin{itemize}
    \item \textbf{C0: require\_project\_status} \\
    All active projects must have status = "active": \\
    $\forall p \in \mathcal{P}: \text{status}(p) = \text{active}$ (Must-Match, weight $2.0$)

    \item \textbf{C1: forbid\_inactive\_workers} \\
    No inactive workers allowed: \\
    $\forall w \in \mathcal{W}: \text{status}(w) \neq \text{inactive}$ (Cannot-Match, weight $1.8$)

    \item \textbf{C2: require\_team\_location} \\
    Teams must be located in allowed regions (e.g., EU): \\
    $\forall t \in \mathcal{T}: \text{location}(t) \in \{\text{EU, US, APAC}\}$ (Must-Match, weight $1.5$)

    \item \textbf{C3: limit\_worker\_availability} \\
    Worker availability must be at least threshold: \\
    $\forall w \in \mathcal{W}: \text{availability}(w) \geq 0.7$ (May-Match, weight $1.2$)

    \item \textbf{C4: require\_feature\_status} \\
    Only planned or in-progress features allowed: \\
    $\forall f \in \mathcal{F}: \text{status}(f) \in \{\text{planned, in\_progress}\}$ (Must-Match, weight $1.4$)

    \item \textbf{C5: forbid\_completed\_sprints} \\
    Exclude already completed sprints: \\
    $\forall sp \in \mathcal{SP}: \text{status}(sp) \neq \text{completed}$ (Cannot-Match, weight $1.3$)

    \item \textbf{C6: require\_skill\_certification} \\
    Critical skills must be certified: \\
    $\forall s \in \mathcal{S}, \forall w \in \mathcal{W}: \text{has\_skill}(w,s) \Rightarrow \text{certified}(s) = \text{true}$ (Must-Match, weight $1.9$)

    \item \textbf{C7: require\_role\_responsibility} \\
    All roles must define responsibility area: \\
    $\forall r \in \mathcal{R}: \text{area\_of\_responsibility}(r) \neq \emptyset$ (Must-Match, weight $1.1$)

    \item \textbf{C8: require\_backlog\_status} \\
    Product Backlog must be active: \\
    $\forall pb \in \mathcal{PB}: \text{status}(pb) = \text{active}$ (Must-Match, weight $1.6$)

    \item \textbf{C9: require\_sprint\_goal\_defined} \\
    Every sprint must have a defined goal: \\
    $\forall sp \in \mathcal{SP}: \exists sg \in \mathcal{SG} \text{ s.t. } \text{pursues\_goal}(sp, sg) \land \text{objective\_description}(sg) \neq \emptyset$ (Must-Match, weight $2.0$)

    \item \textbf{C10: forbid\_high\_effort\_tasks} \\
    Tasks with effort > 8 are disallowed: \\
    $\forall tsk \in \mathcal{TSK}: \text{effort}(tsk) \leq 8$ (Cannot-Match, weight $1.4$)

    \item \textbf{C11: require\_user\_story\_priority} \\
    User stories must have priority in \{high, medium\}: \\
    $\forall us \in \mathcal{US}: \text{priority}(us) \in \{\text{high, medium}\}$ (Must-Match, weight $1.3$)

    \item \textbf{C12: require\_snapshot\_deployment} \\
    Every snapshot must have a deployment target: \\
    $\forall dev \in \mathcal{DEV}: \text{deployment\_target}(dev) \neq \emptyset$ (Must-Match, weight $1.2$)

    \item \textbf{C13: require\_stakeholder\_relevance} \\
    Stakeholders must be relevant to current feature: \\
    $\forall sh \in \mathcal{SH}, f \in \mathcal{F}: \text{participates\_in}(sh, f) \Rightarrow \text{relevance\_to\_feature}(sh, f) = \text{high or medium}$ (Must-Match, weight $1.0$)

    \item \textbf{C14: require\_retrospective\_actions} \\
    Retrospectives must define improvement actions: \\
    $\forall sre \in \mathcal{SRE}: \text{improvement\_actions}(sre) \neq \emptyset$ (Must-Match, weight $1.7$)
\end{itemize}

\section{5. Decision Variables}
\begin{itemize}
    \item $dv_0 \in \mathbb{Z}^+$: \texttt{project\_count}, number of concurrent projects, domain: $\{0,1,2,3,4,5\}$, $0 \leq dv_0 \leq 5$

    \item $dv_1 \in \mathbb{Z}^+$: \texttt{team\_size\_allocation}, size of team per project, domain: $\{1,\dots,10\}$, $1 \leq dv_1 \leq 10$

    \item $dv_2 \in \{0,1\}$: \texttt{worker\_assignment}, binary assignment of worker to task, $dv_2 = 1$ if assigned, $0 \leq dv_2 \leq 1$

    \item $dv_3 \in \mathbb{Z}^+$: \texttt{skill\_level\_threshold}, minimum required skill level, domain: $\{1,2,3,4,5\}$, $1 \leq dv_3 \leq 5$

    \item $dv_4 \in \mathbb{Z}^+$: \texttt{role\_assignment\_count}, number of roles per worker, domain: $\{0,1,2,3\}$, $0 \leq dv_4 \leq 3$

    \item $dv_5 \in \mathbb{Z}^+$: \texttt{sprint\_duration\_days}, sprint length in days, domain: $\{5,10,14,21,28\}$, $5 \leq dv_5 \leq 28$

    \item $dv_6 \in \mathbb{Z}^+$: \texttt{story\_points\_per\_sprint}, max story points per sprint, domain: $\{5,\dots,40\}$, $5 \leq dv_6 \leq 40$

    \item $dv_7 \in \mathbb{Z}^+$: \texttt{task\_effort\_estimate}, effort estimate per task, domain: $\{1,2,3,5,8,13\}$, $1 \leq dv_7 \leq 13$

    \item $dv_8 \in \mathbb{R}^+$: \texttt{release\_version\_number}, version identifier, domain: $[1.0, 5.0]$, $1.0 \leq dv_8 \leq 5.0$

    \item $dv_9 \in \mathbb{Z}^+$: \texttt{documentation\_update\_frequency}, days between updates, domain: $\{1,7,14,30\}$, $1 \leq dv_9 \leq 30$

    \item $dv_{10} \in \mathbb{Z}^+$: \texttt{blocker\_resolution\_time}, max days to resolve blocker, $1 \leq dv_{10} \leq 14$

    \item $dv_{11} \in \mathbb{Z}^+$: \texttt{velocity\_calculation\_window}, number of sprints for average, domain: $\{3,4,5,6\}$, $3 \leq dv_{11} \leq 6$

    \item $dv_{12} \in \mathbb{Z}^+$: \texttt{roadmap\_milestone\_count}, number of milestones, $1 \leq dv_{12} \leq 8$

    \item $dv_{13} \in \mathbb{Z}^+$: \texttt{board\_column\_count}, number of workflow columns, $3 \leq dv_{13} \leq 6$

    \item $dv_{14} \in \mathbb{Z}^+$: \texttt{stakeholder\_engagement\_level}, engagement score, domain: $\{1,2,3,4,5\}$, $1 \leq dv_{14} \leq 5$
\end{itemize}

\end{document}
```

---

### âœ… Features of This LaTeX Document:
- **Title Page**: Includes title, author, and date.
- **Table of Contents**: Auto-generated.
- **Structured Sections**: Clear separation of entities, indices, goals, conditions, and decision variables.
- **Mathematical Notation**: Uses `amsmath` and proper set/index notation.
- **Logical Constraints**: Conditions are expressed as logical implications or inequalities.
- **Weight Integration**: All goals and conditions include their weights for weighted objective/constraint scoring.
- **Domain Compliance**: All variables reflect their domains and bounds.

You can compile this with any LaTeX processor (e.g., Overleaf, TeXLive) to generate a professional PDF report. Let me know if you'd like a version with objective function aggregation or constraint relaxation modeling.

Transform all of the provided and generated CSV data (Entities, Attributes, Relations, Goals, Conditions, DecisionVariables) into a graph using the Mermaid.js Live Editor graph TD syntax.
Connect...
- Entities with their Attributes and place the Attributes around the Entities they belong to. (can exist multiple times in the graph to make lines less short)
- Entities with their Relations
- Goals with the Entity/Attributes
- Conditions with the Entity/Attributes
- DecisionVariables with their relevant Entities

Colorize...
- Entities in blue
- Attributes in white
- Relations in orange
- Goals in green
- Conditions in red
- Decision Variables in purple

Based on Entities.csv and Relationships.csv - Proceed and Create 3 individual CSV code-blocks (alternative: files) in chat named: Goals.csv + Conditions.csv + DecisionVariables.csv
Goals.csv must have the following header: "ID,Name,Description,IsSum,GoalType,EntityName,EntityAttribute,CriteriaType,Weight"
Conditions.csv must have the following header: "ID,Name,Description,IsSum,GoalType,EntityName,EntityAttribute,CriteriaType,Weight"
DecisionVariables.csv must have the following header: "ID,Name,Description,DataType,Domain,MinValue,MaxValue"

The following conventions must be applied:
ID starts with a letter G(oals), C(onditions), D(ecision)V(ariables) and a number follows, starting at 0, 1, 2, ....
Name is written snake_case
Names for Goals must begin with "maximize_" or "minimize_"
IsSum is a boolean { True, False }
GoalType is one of { "min", "max" }
EntityName is always only 1 entry from the "Name" of Entities.csv
EntityAttribute is one of the values in the "Attribute0" to "Attribute8" of the targeted Entity in Entities.csv
CriteriaType is a number { 2 = Must-Match, 1 = May-Match, 0 = Cannot-Match }
Domain can represent set of values like "{0,1}"
MinValue is the smallest value that can be set
MaxValue is the highest value that can be set
Weight is a mulptlier
Created 10 to 15 entries in each of these files.

Use ALL of the previously provided and generated CSV data (Entities, Relations, Goals, Conditions, DecisionVariables) and formulate the optimization model mathematically and logically. 
Write it into a code-block for a LaTeX (.tex) file and provide the generated Latex code in chat.
The file consists of a introduction page with Title, Author, Date and Table of Contents.
The actual file contest consists of 5 different \sections labeled "1. Sets (Entities)", "2. Indices", "3. Goals", "4. Conditions", "5. DecisionVariables"
The items of each category are itemized between \begin and \end.
Goals and Conditions show both their IDs, Names and the logical and mathematical representation

content_list.content:
Here is a complete LaTeX `.tex` file that formulates the optimization model based on the provided domain model (Entities, Relationships, Goals, Conditions, and Decision Variables). It includes a title page, table of contents, and five structured sections with mathematical and logical representations.

```latex
\documentclass[12pt]{article}
\usepackage[utf8]{inputenc}
\usepackage{amsmath, amssymb}
\usepackage{geometry}
\usepackage{titlesec}
\usepackage{enumitem}
\usepackage{hyperref}
\usepackage{setspace}

\geometry{margin=1in}
\titleformat{\section}{\large\bfseries}{}{0em}{}[{\titlerule[0.5pt]}]
\setlength{\parindent}{0pt}
\onehalfspacing

\title{\Huge Scrum-Based Software Development Optimization Model \\ \Large A Mathematical Formulation}
\author{\Large AI Assistant \\ Optimization & Decision Modeling}
\date{\today}

\begin{document}

\maketitle
\tableofcontents
\newpage

\section{1. Sets (Entities)}
\begin{itemize}
    \item $\mathcal{P}$: Set of Projects, where each $p \in \mathcal{P}$ has attributes: $id$, $name$, $project\_start$, $project\_end$, $description$, $budget$, $status$, $target\_audience$, $priority$.
    \item $\mathcal{T}$: Set of Teams, where each $t \in \mathcal{T}$ has attributes: $id$, $name$, $team\_size$, $team\_start$, $team\_status$, $location$, $team\_type$.
    \item $\mathcal{W}$: Set of Workers, where each $w \in \mathcal{W}$ has attributes: $id$, $name$, $first\_name$, $email$, $start\_date$, $status$, $availability$.
    \item $\mathcal{F}$: Set of Features, where each $f \in \mathcal{F}$ has attributes: $id$, $title$, $description$, $status$, $priority$, $estimated\_effort$.
    \item $\mathcal{S}$: Set of Skills, where each $s \in \mathcal{S}$ has attributes: $id$, $label$, $description$, $level$, $certified$, $category$.
    \item $\mathcal{R}$: Set of Roles, where each $r \in \mathcal{R}$ has attributes: $id$, $role\_name$, $description$, $area\_of\_responsibility$.
    \item $\mathcal{PO}$: Set of Product Owners, where each $po \in \mathcal{PO}$ has attributes: $id$, $name$, $email$, $availability$.
    \item $\mathcal{SM}$: Set of Scrum Masters, where each $sm \in \mathcal{SM}$ has attributes: $id$, $name$, $email$, $experience$.
    \item $\mathcal{PB}$: Set of Product Backlogs, where each $pb \in \mathcal{PB}$ has attributes: $id$, $created\_on$, $last\_updated$, $number\_of\_entries$, $status$.
    \item $\mathcal{SP}$: Set of Sprints, where each $sp \in \mathcal{SP}$ has attributes: $id$, $sprint\_number$, $start\_date$, $end\_date$, $status$, $achievement\_of\_goal$.
    \item $\mathcal{SPP}$: Set of Sprint Plannings, where each $spp \in \mathcal{SPP}$ has attributes: $id$, $date$, $duration\_(min)$, $moderation$, $outcome\_documentation$.
    \item $\mathcal{DS}$: Set of Daily Scrums, where each $ds \in \mathcal{DS}$ has attributes: $id$, $date$, $time$, $duration$, $moderation$.
    \item $\mathcal{SR}$: Set of Sprint Reviews, where each $sr \in \mathcal{SR}$ has attributes: $id$, $date$, $duration$, $feedback\_documentation$, $attendees\_count$.
    \item $\mathcal{SRE}$: Set of Sprint Retrospectives, where each $sre \in \mathcal{SRE}$ has attributes: $id$, $date$, $duration$, $improvement\_actions$, $team\_satisfaction$, $moderation$.
    \item $\mathcal{SBL}$: Set of Sprint Backlogs, where each $sbl \in \mathcal{SBL}$ has attributes: $id$, $number\_of\_tasks$, $last\_updated$, $status$, $total\_effort$.
    \item $\mathcal{SG}$: Set of Sprint Goals, where each $sg \in \mathcal{SG}$ has attributes: $id$, $objective\_description$, $achievement\_status$, $benefit$.
    \item $\mathcal{E}$: Set of Epics, where each $e \in \mathcal{E}$ has attributes: $id$, $title$, $description$, $priority$, $status$, $estimated\_effort$.
    \item $\mathcal{US}$: Set of User Stories, where each $us \in \mathcal{US}$ has attributes: $id$, $title$, $description$, $acceptance\_criteria$, $priority$, $story\_points$, $status$.
    \item $\mathcal{TSK}$: Set of Tasks, where each $tsk \in \mathcal{TSK}$ has attributes: $id$, $title$, $description$, $status$, $effort$, $type$.
    \item $\mathcal{DEV}$: Set of Development Snapshots, where each $dev \in \mathcal{DEV}$ has attributes: $id$, $version\_number$, $creation\_date$, $test\_status$, $deployment\_target$, $documentation$.
    \item $\mathcal{BL}$: Set of Blockers, where each $bl \in \mathcal{BL}$ has attributes: $id$, $title$, $description$, $severity$, $status$, $detected\_on$, $resolved\_on$.
    \item $\mathcal{SH}$: Set of Stakeholders, where each $sh \in \mathcal{SH}$ has attributes: $id$, $name$, $organization$, $role$, $email$, $area\_of\_interest$, $influence\_level$, $relevance\_to\_feature$.
    \item $\mathcal{VEL}$: Set of Velocity Records, where each $vel \in \mathcal{VEL}$ has attributes: $id$, $number\_of\_sprints\_used$, $avg.\_story\_points$, $max\_velocity$, $min\_velocity$, $trend$.
    \item $\mathcal{REP}$: Set of Release Plans, where each $rep \in \mathcal{REP}$ has attributes: $id$, $version$, $planned\_date$, $included\_features$, $status$.
    \item $\mathcal{RM}$: Set of Roadmaps, where each $rm \in \mathcal{RM}$ has attributes: $id$, $start\_date$, $end\_date$, $milestones$, $objectives$, $versions$.
    \item $\mathcal{SCB}$: Set of Scrum Boards, where each $scb \in \mathcal{SCB}$ has attributes: $id$, $board\_type$, $columns\_(todo/done...)$, $number\_of\_cards$, $last\_updated$.
    \item $\mathcal{FED}$: Set of Feature Documentations, where each $fed \in \mathcal{FED}$ has attributes: $id$, $title$, $description$, $creation\_date$, $change\_log$, $linked\_requirements$, $author$.
\end{itemize}

\section{2. Indices}
\begin{itemize}
    \item $p \in \mathcal{P}$: Index over Projects.
    \item $t \in \mathcal{T}$: Index over Teams.
    \item $w \in \mathcal{W}$: Index over Workers.
    \item $f \in \mathcal{F}$: Index over Features.
    \item $s \in \mathcal{S}$: Index over Skills.
    \item $r \in \mathcal{R}$: Index over Roles.
    \item $sp \in \mathcal{SP}$: Index over Sprints.
    \item $us \in \mathcal{US}$: Index over User Stories.
    \item $tsk \in \mathcal{TSK}$: Index over Tasks.
    \item $bl \in \mathcal{BL}$: Index over Blockers.
    \item $sh \in \mathcal{SH}$: Index over Stakeholders.
    \item $vel \in \mathcal{VEL}$: Index over Velocity records.
    \item $rep \in \mathcal{REP}$: Index over Release Plans.
    \item $rm \in \mathcal{RM}$: Index over Roadmaps.
\end{itemize}

\section{3. Goals}
\begin{itemize}
    \item \textbf{G0: maximize\_project\_budget} \\
    Maximize total project budget: \\
    $\max \sum_{p \in \mathcal{P}} \text{budget}(p)$ with weight $1.5$

    \item \textbf{G1: minimize\_project\_duration} \\
    Minimize total project duration: \\
    $\min \sum_{p \in \mathcal{P}} (\text{project\_end}(p) - \text{project\_start}(p))$ with weight $1.2$

    \item \textbf{G2: maximize\_team\_size} \\
    Maximize combined team sizes: \\
    $\max \sum_{t \in \mathcal{T}} \text{team\_size}(t)$ with weight $0.8$

    \item \textbf{G3: minimize\_worker\_start\_date} \\
    Favor earlier hiring: \\
    $\min \sum_{w \in \mathcal{W}} \text{start\_date}(w)$ with weight $1.0$

    \item \textbf{G4: maximize\_feature\_priority} \\
    Maximize sum of feature priorities: \\
    $\max \sum_{f \in \mathcal{F}} \text{priority}(f)$ with weight $1.3$

    \item \textbf{G5: minimize\_story\_points} \\
    Minimize total story points in backlog: \\
    $\min \sum_{us \in \mathcal{US}} \text{story\_points}(us)$ with weight $0.9$

    \item \textbf{G6: maximize\_sprint\_achievement} \\
    Maximize average sprint goal achievement: \\
    $\max \frac{1}{|\mathcal{SP}|} \sum_{sp \in \mathcal{SP}} \text{achievement\_of\_goal}(sp)$ with weight $1.6$

    \item \textbf{G7: minimize\_sprint\_duration} \\
    Minimize sprint length: \\
    $\min \sum_{sp \in \mathcal{SP}} (\text{end\_date}(sp) - \text{start\_date}(sp))$ with weight $0.7$

    \item \textbf{G8: maximize\_velocity\_trend} \\
    Maximize positive velocity trend: \\
    $\max \sum_{vel \in \mathcal{VEL}} \text{trend}(vel)$ with weight $1.4$

    \item \textbf{G9: minimize\_task\_effort} \\
    Minimize total effort across tasks: \\
    $\min \sum_{tsk \in \mathcal{TSK}} \text{effort}(tsk)$ with weight $1.1$

    \item \textbf{G10: maximize\_release\_inclusion} \\
    Maximize number of features per release: \\
    $\max \sum_{rep \in \mathcal{REP}} |\text{included\_features}(rep)|$ with weight $1.3$

    \item \textbf{G11: minimize\_documentation\_age} \\
    Favor recent documentation: \\
    $\min \sum_{fed \in \mathcal{FED}} (\text{current\_date} - \text{creation\_date}(fed))$ with weight $0.6$

    \item \textbf{G12: maximize\_board\_card\_count} \\
    Maximize active task visibility: \\
    $\max \sum_{scb \in \mathcal{SCB}} \text{number\_of\_cards}(scb)$ with weight $0.9$

    \item \textbf{G13: minimize\_blocker\_severity} \\
    Reduce impact of blockers: \\
    $\min \sum_{bl \in \mathcal{BL}} \text{severity}(bl)$ with weight $1.7$

    \item \textbf{G14: maximize\_stakeholder\_influence} \\
    Maximize influence of engaged stakeholders: \\
    $\max \sum_{sh \in \mathcal{SH}} \text{influence\_level}(sh)$ with weight $1.0$
\end{itemize}

\section{4. Conditions}
\begin{itemize}
    \item \textbf{C0: require\_project\_status} \\
    All active projects must have status = "active": \\
    $\forall p \in \mathcal{P}: \text{status}(p) = \text{active}$ (Must-Match, weight $2.0$)

    \item \textbf{C1: forbid\_inactive\_workers} \\
    No inactive workers allowed: \\
    $\forall w \in \mathcal{W}: \text{status}(w) \neq \text{inactive}$ (Cannot-Match, weight $1.8$)

    \item \textbf{C2: require\_team\_location} \\
    Teams must be located in allowed regions (e.g., EU): \\
    $\forall t \in \mathcal{T}: \text{location}(t) \in \{\text{EU, US, APAC}\}$ (Must-Match, weight $1.5$)

    \item \textbf{C3: limit\_worker\_availability} \\
    Worker availability must be at least threshold: \\
    $\forall w \in \mathcal{W}: \text{availability}(w) \geq 0.7$ (May-Match, weight $1.2$)

    \item \textbf{C4: require\_feature\_status} \\
    Only planned or in-progress features allowed: \\
    $\forall f \in \mathcal{F}: \text{status}(f) \in \{\text{planned, in\_progress}\}$ (Must-Match, weight $1.4$)

    \item \textbf{C5: forbid\_completed\_sprints} \\
    Exclude already completed sprints: \\
    $\forall sp \in \mathcal{SP}: \text{status}(sp) \neq \text{completed}$ (Cannot-Match, weight $1.3$)

    \item \textbf{C6: require\_skill\_certification} \\
    Critical skills must be certified: \\
    $\forall s \in \mathcal{S}, \forall w \in \mathcal{W}: \text{has\_skill}(w,s) \Rightarrow \text{certified}(s) = \text{true}$ (Must-Match, weight $1.9$)

    \item \textbf{C7: require\_role\_responsibility} \\
    All roles must define responsibility area: \\
    $\forall r \in \mathcal{R}: \text{area\_of\_responsibility}(r) \neq \emptyset$ (Must-Match, weight $1.1$)

    \item \textbf{C8: require\_backlog\_status} \\
    Product Backlog must be active: \\
    $\forall pb \in \mathcal{PB}: \text{status}(pb) = \text{active}$ (Must-Match, weight $1.6$)

    \item \textbf{C9: require\_sprint\_goal\_defined} \\
    Every sprint must have a defined goal: \\
    $\forall sp \in \mathcal{SP}: \exists sg \in \mathcal{SG} \text{ s.t. } \text{pursues\_goal}(sp, sg) \land \text{objective\_description}(sg) \neq \emptyset$ (Must-Match, weight $2.0$)

    \item \textbf{C10: forbid\_high\_effort\_tasks} \\
    Tasks with effort > 8 are disallowed: \\
    $\forall tsk \in \mathcal{TSK}: \text{effort}(tsk) \leq 8$ (Cannot-Match, weight $1.4$)

    \item \textbf{C11: require\_user\_story\_priority} \\
    User stories must have priority in \{high, medium\}: \\
    $\forall us \in \mathcal{US}: \text{priority}(us) \in \{\text{high, medium}\}$ (Must-Match, weight $1.3$)

    \item \textbf{C12: require\_snapshot\_deployment} \\
    Every snapshot must have a deployment target: \\
    $\forall dev \in \mathcal{DEV}: \text{deployment\_target}(dev) \neq \emptyset$ (Must-Match, weight $1.2$)

    \item \textbf{C13: require\_stakeholder\_relevance} \\
    Stakeholders must be relevant to current feature: \\
    $\forall sh \in \mathcal{SH}, f \in \mathcal{F}: \text{participates\_in}(sh, f) \Rightarrow \text{relevance\_to\_feature}(sh, f) = \text{high or medium}$ (Must-Match, weight $1.0$)

    \item \textbf{C14: require\_retrospective\_actions} \\
    Retrospectives must define improvement actions: \\
    $\forall sre \in \mathcal{SRE}: \text{improvement\_actions}(sre) \neq \emptyset$ (Must-Match, weight $1.7$)
\end{itemize}

\section{5. Decision Variables}
\begin{itemize}
    \item $dv_0 \in \mathbb{Z}^+$: \texttt{project\_count}, number of concurrent projects, domain: $\{0,1,2,3,4,5\}$, $0 \leq dv_0 \leq 5$

    \item $dv_1 \in \mathbb{Z}^+$: \texttt{team\_size\_allocation}, size of team per project, domain: $\{1,\dots,10\}$, $1 \leq dv_1 \leq 10$

    \item $dv_2 \in \{0,1\}$: \texttt{worker\_assignment}, binary assignment of worker to task, $dv_2 = 1$ if assigned, $0 \leq dv_2 \leq 1$

    \item $dv_3 \in \mathbb{Z}^+$: \texttt{skill\_level\_threshold}, minimum required skill level, domain: $\{1,2,3,4,5\}$, $1 \leq dv_3 \leq 5$

    \item $dv_4 \in \mathbb{Z}^+$: \texttt{role\_assignment\_count}, number of roles per worker, domain: $\{0,1,2,3\}$, $0 \leq dv_4 \leq 3$

    \item $dv_5 \in \mathbb{Z}^+$: \texttt{sprint\_duration\_days}, sprint length in days, domain: $\{5,10,14,21,28\}$, $5 \leq dv_5 \leq 28$

    \item $dv_6 \in \mathbb{Z}^+$: \texttt{story\_points\_per\_sprint}, max story points per sprint, domain: $\{5,\dots,40\}$, $5 \leq dv_6 \leq 40$

    \item $dv_7 \in \mathbb{Z}^+$: \texttt{task\_effort\_estimate}, effort estimate per task, domain: $\{1,2,3,5,8,13\}$, $1 \leq dv_7 \leq 13$

    \item $dv_8 \in \mathbb{R}^+$: \texttt{release\_version\_number}, version identifier, domain: $[1.0, 5.0]$, $1.0 \leq dv_8 \leq 5.0$

    \item $dv_9 \in \mathbb{Z}^+$: \texttt{documentation\_update\_frequency}, days between updates, domain: $\{1,7,14,30\}$, $1 \leq dv_9 \leq 30$

    \item $dv_{10} \in \mathbb{Z}^+$: \texttt{blocker\_resolution\_time}, max days to resolve blocker, $1 \leq dv_{10} \leq 14$

    \item $dv_{11} \in \mathbb{Z}^+$: \texttt{velocity\_calculation\_window}, number of sprints for average, domain: $\{3,4,5,6\}$, $3 \leq dv_{11} \leq 6$

    \item $dv_{12} \in \mathbb{Z}^+$: \texttt{roadmap\_milestone\_count}, number of milestones, $1 \leq dv_{12} \leq 8$

    \item $dv_{13} \in \mathbb{Z}^+$: \texttt{board\_column\_count}, number of workflow columns, $3 \leq dv_{13} \leq 6$

    \item $dv_{14} \in \mathbb{Z}^+$: \texttt{stakeholder\_engagement\_level}, engagement score, domain: $\{1,2,3,4,5\}$, $1 \leq dv_{14} \leq 5$
\end{itemize}

\end{document}
```

---

### âœ… Features of This LaTeX Document:
- **Title Page**: Includes title, author, and date.
- **Table of Contents**: Auto-generated.
- **Structured Sections**: Clear separation of entities, indices, goals, conditions, and decision variables.
- **Mathematical Notation**: Uses `amsmath` and proper set/index notation.
- **Logical Constraints**: Conditions are expressed as logical implications or inequalities.
- **Weight Integration**: All goals and conditions include their weights for weighted objective/constraint scoring.
- **Domain Compliance**: All variables reflect their domains and bounds.

You can compile this with any LaTeX processor (e.g., Overleaf, TeXLive) to generate a professional PDF report. Let me know if you'd like a version with objective function aggregation or constraint relaxation modeling.

Transform all of the provided and generated CSV data (Entities, Attributes, Relations, Goals, Conditions, DecisionVariables) into a graph using the Mermaid.js Live Editor graph TD syntax.
Connect...
- Entities with their Attributes and place the Attributes around the Entities they belong to. (can exist multiple times in the graph to make lines less short)
- Entities with their Relations
- Goals with the Entity/Attributes
- Conditions with the Entity/Attributes
- DecisionVariables with their relevant Entities

Colorize...
- Entities in blue
- Attributes in white
- Relations in orange
- Goals in green
- Conditions in red
- Decision Variables in purple
